page.title: 01The Hills East of Ffestiniog
page.content:
This is an area of low hills and mountains. Manod Mawr is the highest at 216 feet (661 metres) a region of bare rock and steep slopes. Three SE flowing streams, connected to a lake and reservoir, drain the area.
This is a landscape of rough grassland, heather and bare rock interspersed with areas of poorly drained land. Old mine workings and quarries abound though today there is only one active roadstone quarry.
Few people live and work here. One farm, a former farmhouse, used as a holiday home and water treatment plant are the only buildings of any size. Sheep are the dominant livestock.
A network of poorly defined footpaths
